abstract: When the country’s three largest banks reached agreement on Friday on how to structure a $75 billion fund to prop up distressed securities, an exhausted group of its top planners reportedly gathered in a Bank of America conference room to toast their success with 12-packs of Bud Light.
lead_paragraph: When the country’s three largest banks reached agreement on Friday on how to structure a $75 billion fund to prop up distressed securities, an exhausted group of its top planners reportedly gathered in a Bank of America conference room to toast their success with 12-packs of Bud Light.

headline.main: Some Wonder if Banks’ Stabilization Fund Will Work
